misuses.description: The SecureRandom class is not seeded properly. The seed should be of sufficient size and complexity to prevent attackers from predicting the next pseudorandom number generated by the algorithm.
misuses.recommendation: Use a cryptographically secure random number generator like SecureRandom.getInstanceStrong() or SplittableRandom.getInstance() to generate the seed.

misuses.description: The seed should be of sufficient size and complexity to prevent attackers from predicting the next pseudorandom number generated by the algorithm. Using a byte array with a single value does not provide enough entropy to be considered secure.
misuses.recommendation: Use a cryptographically secure random number generator like SecureRandom.getInstanceStrong() or SplittableRandom.getInstance() to generate the seed.
